body:
I've talked with @jeremy about this issue and it seems like it doesn't really make sense to add a ``uniq`` check on insertion of records because of the possibility of race conditions. For example, the ``validates_uniqueness_of`` method http://api.rubyonrails.org/classes/ActiveRecord/Validations/ClassMethods.html falls prey to race conditions, and adding a uniqueness check on insertion doesn't necessarily provide guarantees. 

The best way to get around this is to just use a uniqueness index in the join table itself. For example, something like:
```ruby
add_index :table_name, :column_name, :unique => true
```
